meanings.definition: To arrange or organize (something) in a new way.
meanings.sent1: I am reindexing my bookshelf to put all the books in order.
meanings.sent2: The librarian is reindexing the library catalog to make it easier to find books.
meanings.sent3: Reindexing my closet feels like solving a fun puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a constantly reindexing computer, always sorting through information.
meanings.sent5: The reindexing of the files brought a sense of clarity to the chaos.

meanings.definition: To update or refresh an index or database.
meanings.sent1: The IT team is reindexing the search engine to improve search results.
meanings.sent2: After reindexing the database, the search function worked much faster.
meanings.sent3: Reindexing the online store felt like giving it a digital makeover.
meanings.sent4: His memory worked like a constantly reindexing database, retrieving information swiftly.
meanings.sent5: The reindexing of the website led to a significant increase in user satisfaction.
